channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Agentic AI is the technology’s new frontier, and CAIOs are toiling to get agents implemented correctly
item.description: “There’s a ton of confusion in the marketplace with our clients on, ‘What is an AI agent? What am I deploying?’”

item.title: Unemployed graduates are flocking to this business degree to stand out in the current job market—unlike most MBAs it requires zero work experience
item.description: Gen Z graduates down on their luck amid AI jobs automation are turning to masters of management degrees—no business expertise or work experience requi...

item.title: You just hired your first CAIO. Now what?
item.description: Today’s CAIOs have broad mandates that can include data management, AI governance, workflow change management, as well as developing partnerships with...

item.title: What almost dying—again—taught me about authentic leadership
item.description: Surviving forced me to reflect on how I lead, live and the unhealthy work habits I once followed — first to arrive, last to leave, working through hac...

item.title: Maturing AI, business impact, and agents galore: How the CAIO role has evolved over the past year
item.description: “A year ago, my focus was on proving that autonomous AI decision-making systems could exist. Today, it’s about delivery and scale.”
